taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus symphyotrichum;subgenus astropolium;species subulatum;variety ligulatum

bio:treatment.description: Plants (10–)60–200 cm. Stems usually simple, sometimes branched proximally. Heads 15–120, in open, diffuse arrays, secund on primary branches longer than peduncles. Involucres (5.2–)6–6.9 mm. Phyllaries 25–45(–62), subulate to lanceolate, narrow, green zones narrowly lanceolate. Ray florets 17–30(–45) in 1 series; laminae lavender to blue, (3.5–)4.5–7 × 0.9–1.3 mm, longer than pappi, drying in 3–5 coils (apices shallowly lobed). Disc florets (20–)33–50; corollas 3.7–4.5(–5) mm. Cypselae (1.3–)1.7–2.5(–2.9) mm; pappi (3–)3.5–4.6 mm. 2n = 10.
Marshy habitats, often weedy, roadsides, lawns, waste places;
Ala., Ark., Kans., La., Miss., Nebr., N.Mex., Okla., Tenn., Tex.; Mexico (Chihuahua, Coahuila, Tamaulipas).
bio:treatment.other_name: Saltmarsh or southern annual saltmarsh aster
